results.title: Ozala
results.brief_description:
“Ozala” is an Afghani refugee who spent three years in a detention centre - his only crime was in wanting freedom. During this time in prison Ozala discovered the art of painting, where he could express his emotions, where shapes and colors became symbolic of his life and experiences and where he could escape to freedom. A thoughtful and reflective film interspersed with images of Ozala’s paintings.
In Farsi (Persian) with English subtitles

results.title: Paranoid
results.brief_description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.
results.description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.

results.title: From Melville to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Tristan Mungatopi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Growing up in two worlds allows me to give back to my community. Tristan Mungatopi, a young Tiwi man’s search for identity and connection.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: Waterholes : our turn
results.creator_credit: Kaye Munroe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kaye Munroe remembers the day the devastating Gippsland bushfires came to her doorstep. The ‘travelling fingers’ of the bushfire threatened not only her home but the beauty of the area she loved. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: My nightmare has just begun
results.creator_credit: Linda Lord, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Lord recounts the day the Gippsland bushfires came to her home. Despite undergoing fire training and preparation, when the fire front approached, there was no time to think. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: D-Day
results.creator_credit: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Darryl Jordan and his partner prepare their home for the encroaching bushfires. The wait for D-day is all-consuming for this family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Grateful angels
results.creator_credit: Roslyn Evans, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Grateful and Angels are Roslyn Evans’ treasured cows that she nearly lost in the Gippsland bushfires. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Community under siege
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Davies, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In her role as a co-ordinator of the community centre, Suzanne Davies recounts the devastation that the Gippsland bushfires caused her community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
